question: 煎餅
sourceMnemonic: What do you get when you <kanji>roast</kanji> <kanji>mochi</kanji>? <vocabulary>Senbei</vocabulary>, a crispy Japanese <vocabulary>rice cracker</vocabulary>!
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You haven't learned the on'yomi for the second kanji, but if you remember the meaning of the word, that will get you to the reading. In case you're having trouble, here's a mnemonic to help:

You sit eating <vocabulary>senbei</vocabulary> next to a <reading>bay</reading> (<ja>べい</ja>), looking out over the water as you crunch.
